title: Cold Call Company Hit With Record £200,000 Fine
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Sep 30, 2015, 09:34 BST - UK Markets close in 6 hrs 56 mins Cold Call Company Hit With Record £200,000 Fine By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 25 minutes ago View Photo 

A company has been fined £200,000 after making more than six million automated calls offering 'free' solar panels. 
One complainant stated they were waiting for news of a terminally ill family member and couldn't ignore the phone, and felt powerless against the automated calls from Glasgow-based Home Energy and Lifestyle Management. 
The Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) - whose job it is protect consumers from such nuisance calls - said it received 242 complaints in a little over two months. 
By law, cold-calling companies must have the recipient's permission to make automated calls, but the ICO found this wasn't the case - with Home Energy and Lifestyle Management admitting it didn't even know what the rules were. 
Steve Eckersley, head of enforcement at the ICO said: "This company's ignorance of the law is beyond belief. It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) didn't even bother to find out what the rules were and its badly thought out marketing campaign made people's lives a misery." 
The investigation also found that the calls were misleading because the solar panels being marketed were not necessarily free as implied by the recorded message. 
Paul Santoni, the solicitor representing the company, said: "Home Energy and Lifestyle Management had in fact stopped using the campaign before the ICO investigation commenced. 
"(It) used a reputable third party company to provide software for the marketing campaign and for the making of all calls, which were carried out by an automatic dialing machine." 
According to Mr Santoni, Home Energy and Lifestyle Management will appeal the decision and will also be taking proceedings against the Third Party Company in relation to this issue. 
The £200,000 fine will be reduced by 20% if an early repayment is made. 
The company, which is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, is also part of the Government's controversial Green Deal energy efficiency initiative which is to be scrapped following low take up. 
Just last week the ICO handed out another cold-calling fine to a company called Cold Calls Elimination - the £75,000 sanction was issued for making unsolicited marketing calls. 
According to data from the ICO the most common topic for automated nuisance calls is Payment Protection Insurance (PPI), whilst 'live' calls most regularly relate to accident claims.
